channel.title: Herald-Tribune (Custom RSS - Broad Article Grab)

item.title: The billionaire booster that has plan to save college sports from itself
item.description: DALLAS — He doesn’t need this. He can walk away right now, and leave theunseemly unravelingof college sports to someone else.

item.title: Create your own team in College Football 26 using the Team Builder
item.description: College Football 26 is back, and so too is the popular feature,Team Builder, with plenty of updates.

item.title: 5 Amazon Prime Day deals on rangefinders for the golfer in your life
item.description: For many, golf is a hobby, for others it's a passion, for some it's the bane of their existence; however, one thing we can all agree on is that golf is expensive.

item.title: ☀️ Save 49% on the viral TruSkin Vitamin C Serum with 150,000 reviews
item.description: Of all the beauty products in my skincare cabinet, few have been more effective than theTruSkin Vitamin C Serum—and I'm far from alone in my testimony. Known as one of Amazon's best-selling products, with an average 4.3 rating and over 150,000 reviews (casual), this small but mighty formula is packed with a bevy of nourishing ingredients likehyaluronic acidand vitamins E and C, all of which work in conjunction to create what is (IMO) a miracle serum.

item.title: The new iRobot Roomba Plus 405 is $400 off for Prime Day
item.description: Amazon Prime Dayis here, and one of the smartest home upgrades you can make is on sale for 50% off.

item.title: Amazon Prime Day expands to 4 days for the first time…
item.description: Summertime is here, which means beach days, the Fourth of July and, of course,Amazon Prime Day.

item.title: Gov. DeSantis lets three bills become law without…
item.description: For the first time since he took office in 2019, Gov. Ron DeSantis allowed legislation to become law without his signature.

item.title: Alligator Alcatraz is official name of detention center…
Phillippi Creek remains ignored. Will it flood again?
item.description: Nearly a year agoPhillippi Creek overflowed its banks, flooding dozens of homes, causing hundreds to evacuate and forcing others to be rescued by boat.
